# gran

<!-- badges: start -->
<!-- badges: end -->

The goal of gran (gran: R anachronism nullifier) [^gesis] is to obtain the dependency graph of R packages at a specific time point.

## Installation

You can install the development version of gran like so:

``` r
remotes::install_github("GESIS-Methods-Hub/gran")
```

## Example

To obtain the dependency graph of an R package, use `resolve`

```{r example}
library(gran)
graph <- resolve(pkgs = c("openNLP", "LDAvis", "topicmodels", "quanteda"), snapshot_date = "2020-01-16")
graph
```

```{r example2}
graph$deps_sysreqs
```

---

[^gesis]: Actually, it stands for "GESIS R Archive Network".
